message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.CC

The paper discusses a model for brain plasticity as probabilistic inference, which is related to statistical learning theory. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a new theory of network plasticity that explains experimental data on stochastic aspects of synaptic plasticity, which suggests that it could also belong to the Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The paper also discusses how cortical networks can generalize learned information and compensate for disturbances, which suggests that it could belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. The paper's focus on network plasticity and its functional perspective suggest that it could also belong to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category. Finally, the paper's discussion of cortical networks suggests that it could also belong to the Computational Complexity (cs.CC) sub-category.
